Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel in residential area”
Reviews.Author: TCDenver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply out of place, in a residential area. It took 30-45 minutes to get anywhere each way. There were different shuttle vans with different routes to downtown and MRT stations, but you have to check schedules carefully. After a couple of rides, we opted to take taxi, which cost $40-$60 one way to some attractions downtown, not too bad and much faster. We had an executive level room with some view. The room was very modern, clean, well maintained, and larger than many HK hotels. Service was good, but some did not seem friendly, almost too professional, lacked personal touch, reminded me of some hotel personnel (not the servers nor cleaning ladies) in some hotels in China. The breakfast was surprising good with good variety. You should be able to find something to eat for two or three breakfast. There were only restaurants for local folks in the neighborhood as the hotel is in a residential area. We tried a small restaurant for wonton noodle. It was surprising good and inexpensive, the best wonton noodle we had in HK!!! I assumed it was very authentic and completely local flavor. We ended up buying some dry wonton noodle to take home because we liked it so much! Just remember to bring your own napkins as local restaurants do not provide free napkins!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service.”
Reviews.Author: Brizzy62
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days with my three children aged 11-16 years. I found the service to be good. Kenleung on the tour desk was very helpful in suggesting tours to suit my family dynamic and the manager at the front desk was generous when i needed to stay an extra night and upgraded us to a suite at a reasonable rate that included breakfast for the four of us. The breakfast buffet was excellent and catered for all tastes with plenty of food on offer which really helped setting us up for a day of sightseeing. Also had a facial with 25% off for guests. It was so relaxing and really good value. The downsides to my stay were that my son who doesn't swim was not allowed to join us in the pool area if not swimming and was left to sit in the room alone ,very dissappointing. Also the shower over the pool entry was silly and very annoying as when entering the pool you had to pass under the shower and got wet every time. In the room, the bathroom glass sliding door had mould all over it and the shower did not drain properly with water flowing onto floor area. Housekeeping notified and did not seem overly concerned but did clean the glass. The pool bar service was not friendly and the food was terrible and not cheap. The hotel is not close to anything but the regular free hotel shuttle bus makes up for this taking guests to the main shopping district and subway. Overall, happy with stay and would recommend it for those wanting good value for money. Patricia Costello Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Choose this one (Review and important tips)”
Reviews.Author: iShare
Reviews.Content: Hello, Welcome to Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees! If your are still hesitating, I highly recommend this one. I go to Hong Kong every year, tried a lot of hotels and this one is almost perfect. For this budget, you usually have a very small room in HK, to the point that you ask yourself if normal rooms exist... Well, there you have... I disagree with most travelers who complained about the size, it's enough big, especially when you compare with 90% of the hotels of the same range. The rooms look eastern style, with "normal" space (really!), the beds are large and comfortable. The bathroom has real walls (not "glass walls"), it has the combo bath/shower, with the choice to fix the shower or not, the shower has a good flow (rare!). The only problem is the location, but this is really a small problem: First, yes, the streets around are ugly... but it's only because the buildings are old (the hotel is an exception), you are in HK, one of the safest city in the world, so don't worry! There are tons of supermarkets & great local restaurants in the area, including the one from the hotel itself that is very good. HK is so interesting that you are not going to spend your stay in the area of the hotel anyway... Second, there is no walking distance to a MTR station. BUT, as you read in almost every other comments, there is a very efficient (free) shuttle bus service from the hotel: every 20 minutes (1 hour of break during meal times), approx. 20 min. of travel to Tsim Sha Tsui. If you are patient, there will be normally a new MTR line in 2018 with a station near the hotel, hem. About the staff, I'm not going to repeat all what you alrdy read: great staff, helpful... The lobby is not as bad as lovetravel006 said: it's big and mainly, there are 6 lifts so that you never wait... The facilities are very good too, I let you be surprised by the quality of the swimming pool. Now, important tips... • The meeting point of the Shuttle bus in Tsim Sha Tsui is in front of The Penninsula Office Tower Entrance. At the MTR station: follow exit F signs, then take exit L4. • There is one problem with the shuttle service: it's efficient in july, but you have to fight to have a place in august during the rush hours... In these moments, the drivers have a real hard time: they must fight to stop angry guests when the shuttle is full... It's also off course frustrating for guests who have to wait for the next shuttle. I saw a guest one day who ended up damaging the shuttle with some kicks because he could not have a place after three trials... Mad! There are solutions to this problem, here are three... 1. Take the taxi, it's cheap (apprx. 50 HKD from Tsim Sha Tsui) (the cheapest is from Mong Kok East MTR Station: 30 HKD). 2. The public bus is even cheaper and the number 116 from Quarry Bay has a stop just behind the hotel (approx. 40 minutes from Quarry Bay) (Find more informations about this bus line on Internet). 3. Choose the boat, it's fun! The boat is going from the hotel (I mean from a pier at 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel) to North Point MTR Station in only 20 minutes. Departures every 30 minutes. The only problem: last boat at around 7 AM in North Point (Then take the public bus if you want to come back late). • FROM THE AIRPORT: Honestly, taxis are so cheap, you should not bother using public transportations... Just take a taxi: expect 40 minutes of driving for only 250 HKD... If you want, before leaving with the taxi, you can already buy the public transportation card at the airport as it will be useful for you during all your stay in HK (you can buy it in a "7-Eleven" Shop). This card is called "Octopus card" and works like a prepaid card (I usually initially charge it with 200 HKD). When you use the MTR, the fees are automatically charged on your card when you pass the doors. Simple! • CHANGE: In your country, just make the minimal change for your first day in HK (DO NOT CHANGE ALL YOUR BUDGET IN YOUR COUNTRY; YOU WILL WASTE A LOT!). Then, the best deal is... changing banknotes in a "Bank of China" (They ALWAYS have the best rates, do not choose any other bank). Make your change in the city, not at the airport (there is one near the hotel). Finally, quick words about Hong Kong: HK is the safest and most civilized city of China with Beijing... Highly recommended for everything: shopping, sight-seeing, food, leisures... You will enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: xxLeanie
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially with arranging tours. The rooms were very comfortable and there's lots of quirky design details throughout the hotel. Although the hotel is a little far from the major touristy areas, there are a number of restaurants in the area offering local fare. There is also a regular shuttle bus from the hotel to Tsim Tsa Tshui which makes travelling in HK fairly easy. There's a nice little deli in the hotel foyer that sells fairly decent coffee and pastries if you don't want to do the big hotel breakfast thing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: Juan D
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to stay. We are spending our last evening (6 night stay) and from the time we arrived we have been so well looked after. The room is simply gorgeous and the views (17 floor) are beautiful at night. The free shuttle service is excellent and one night we missed the last one (23:45)at the Middle road drop off and no taxis wanted to take us back to the hotel, so when we contacted the hotel they offered to come collect us. I feel that the staff are professional, courteous and very helpful. The little coffee shop in the lobby has the most friendliest young lady that always smiled and gave us tips on where to go. Be careful of the WIFI charges. As the for the Ghetto look and feel around the hotel it is not as bad as it looks. If the ghetto look is not your style then this will not be for you but I took a half a day walk around this neighbourhood and was so engulfed by the culture and people. Good experience, will always come back

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: sand1977
Reviews.Content: I love to stay here nevertheless the rooms and the washrooms are small. Reason is it is close to the location for what I go to Hongkong. The hotel is nice. Clean and Tidy. The staff is pretty friendly too. The hotel provides free shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui. This place is good for business travelers. Do Ask for upgrade. you may get it if the rooms are available.

Reviews.Title: “holidays in hongkong”
Reviews.Author: 721jolly
Reviews.Content: our stay in harbour plaza was excellent, there shuttel service is the best part. staff is very professional, room service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but racist feel...not a family hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MusTy K
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is beautiful...although i felt that certain staff were racist. I stayed over with 6 of my cousins, we booked two rooms and most of the time we weren't in the hotel because we felt aggrieved by the way some of the staff treated us. One of the staff named Kenneth actuallly shouted at us and belittled us in front of other guests. We even witnessed one of the staff scold a baby!!! We are Indian but born in South Africa. The complimentary shuttle was nice..rooms are small,and there is no were to sit in the lobby. WIFI will cost you 120 HKS for 24 hours. Capital Beijing Hotel was so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property”
Reviews.Author: Welcome4me
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in May 2012 for 4 nights. Decently located hotel. Good rooms. Excellent food. Plus point is the free shuttle service to Tsim Sha Sui which is the happening place of HongKong. Courteous staff. Overall well managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel006
Reviews.Content: Harbour Plaza is a great chain and have lot's of great properties, but this hotel is just not one of them and personally I don't feel it's right for the European market. It's opposite the old HKG Airport in quite a deprived area, but this will eventually house the cruise terminal though. There is nothing in the immediate area of any interest what so ever, it just seems run down and depressing, the closest MTR is a good 15 minute drive away and most taxi drivers didn't know where the hotel is! The hotel has no seating in the lobby except a small cafe, which made it very uncomfortable waiting to meet up with people. It's gimmick is that the lobby is set at an angle of 8 degrees, I didn't really find that too impressive either. The rooms are small, already look a little tired and for some reason the ac made everything feel damp -even the bedding. The room had a sofa and table and tv. I was in a twin bed, I'm 6.3 and know these beds were not made for people my size! Shower was in bath rather than a seperate shower unit. It had an ok restaurant and pool area, and also offers a shuttle bus every 30 minutes to take you to somewhere in HKG that you'd actually like to visit! If you want to stay close to the action or at least a MTR, like your home comforts and rooms that don't feel damp - well this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed as part of Tour”
Reviews.Author: Globezila
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of tour. Location is quite poor. We were bussed around so it was not too bad. We felt the rooms were a bit drab, but had everything we needed at the same time. The breakfast was fine. It was our last night of a 28 day trip so we decided to eat in the Restaurant, it was fine and we enjoyed the night very reasonable prices. Not sure I would book this hotel or recommend. We got to use the pool and that is set in a nice area a bit over looked as is the usual in such a built up area but nice. We used the tables outside the hotel to sit and soak up the sunshine and enjoy a coffee. There is a convenient little coffee shop at the entrance to hotel where you can get a quick coffee, pastry etc. Enjoyed sitting out. It was ok as a quick stop over as part of a tour but not otherwise. Location and getting around could be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “A Frustrating Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra C
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to Hong Kong several times, and each time we like to try a new hotel. However, the Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees (Deluxe Room) is, by far, the worst hotel we've been to - not just in HK, but in any part of the world. Granted, the hotel is new, has a lovely swimming pool, and is located near a 7-11, but the good stuff end here. The moment we entered the room, there was an unpleasant smell. We changed rooms. In the new room, upon looking out the window, we were greeted by an ugly sight of (as one review earlier mentioned) a ghetto-like area. The same night, the bath tub clogged up and our bath water accumulated in the tub. The bedsheets also caused us to break out in rashes every night. All these were still bearable. What really angered us was (1) the one night when we arrived 10 minutes ahead of the scheduled time to catch the shuttle bus back to the hotel, only to see the bus driver drive off, although he obviously saw us waving frantically at him, (2) the fact that we asked for an extension of our check out time from 12pm to 12.30pm only to have our request turned down because the hotel room was apparently booked; at 3.35pm, when I went up to the room to check things out, the lady had only just started cleaning our room, and (3) I was charged HKD240 for the use of WiFi at the hotel lobby, although it was not clearly stated that use of WiFi was chargeable (it was clearly stated that broadband cable in the room was chargeable, but as to the use of wifi in the lobby, it left much room for other interpretations). Sure, every hotel has its fair share of dissatisfied customers, who unfortunately had to bear the brunt of rare cases of hotel non-conformities. We have also had our fair shares of unpleasant experiences at hotels around the world. However, I think the kind of service that this hotel has provided over our 3 day stay there is inexcusably bad and disappointing. No convenience, no comfort, no view, and lousy service - I would never again risk going back there to have a rare and precious holiday ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Just say No!”
Reviews.Author: Jessep666
Reviews.Content: What a mess for a great chain. Firstly this hotel is in an area what I can only describe as the ghetto. Most rooms face a building with barred and broken windows and run down surroundings. Extremely inconvenient as No MTR in walking distance, $40 in a cab to ladies market and pick up the MTR from there. Grim rooms, where everything was damp, including the bedding, every night. All my clothes were damp in my suitcase that was left open. Staff are polite to a point, and broken English is spoken. At 3am I requested a wake up call, only for the hotel to call my room an hour later to re-confirm the time!? Would not recommend to friends sharing a twin room as they are very "intimate" to say the least. Two very narrow single beds were less than an arms length apart and couldn't be moved any further. The bathroom is pokey, and not very private. The pool area is nice, but with views of dilapidated surroundings and apartments towering over, so no sun. Also as an added inconvenience there is no way to access the pool without walking through a shower - ridiculous. Service at the pool bar is also painfully slow and food for the price less than sub par. Cab drivers who know the hotel are far and few between and you may find yourself taken to the metropolis or grand - which are far better choices anyway!

Reviews.Title: “worth checking out when visiting HK”
Reviews.Author: jappybedi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are good and big, staff very helpfull, shuttle to town available, breakfast quite up to the mark, service fast and efficient. Seems a new hotel, all things are shining as of now. They charge for everything you need to be careful of that, even wifi, extra plates.......... that can be a downer. They have a good briyani !!!!!!!!!!!!! Location is a bit out, nothing to do nearby. Does have long lines at checking out. Language sometimes does become a issue. travel best by train in city. Things to do - shopping at tsim sa sui, - Lantau definete visit to Budha thru cable car, lan kwai fong - party time, laser show at harbour,

Reviews.Title: “Good experience and design is updated”
Reviews.Author: Ccb0
Reviews.Content: We stay there few days,the design is good and new. Shuttle is quite frequent ,staff is helpful,help us to carry luggage on cab even we are leaving to other hotel,good room service

Reviews.Title: “Illusion 8 degrees”
Reviews.Author: clubfood
Reviews.Content: A modern, comfortable hotel to stay out of the "touristy areas" but great to explore the local Chinese fresh food markets nearby which we could see from our room. The free shuttle bus does regular runs & taxis are cheap if you want to go further afield. Staff very helpful & friendly. Breakfast good. Happy Hour on the pool deck is a lovely way to start your evening and save a few $s on drinks also the food there was good. The shower over the bath tub dated the bathroom. Careful if you suffer from Vertigo the hotel lobby with its 8 Degree Illusion can take a bit of getting used to. We'd be happy to stay there again. Thank you. Ed & Jenny

Reviews.Title: “Fine if on 'tour'”
Reviews.Author: pineapplesensei
Reviews.Content: Modern, new hotel rooms, decent decor. As previous commenter mentioned, theres no real space in the bathroom to place your toiletries etc. Shower curtains also annoy me (shower over bath). Toielt/ bathroom door only a frosted door, light and movement easily seen through; not great if you are room sharing... Good all-inclusive breakfast. Didnt get a chance to even look at the pool (speaking of which, I dont recall clear signposting or an inviting lobby 'come to the pool'). The hotel is some distance from central HK, and the surrounds are pretty average, not glitzy and not much around, cept a couple of convience stores. Hotel probably best suited for group tours, people that are ferried around the sights of HK on coaches etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: martine_floridahome
Reviews.Content: We were offered an upgrade when we checked in which we snapped up ! It was excellent value for money. The hotel was very full but there were no problems with lifts/ shuttle buses/ restaurants. Reception was manned by brilliant staff and Kasey in particular was extremely helpful. Concierge staff / floor walker again very helpful. We had a leak in the bathroom and someone came from house keeping immediately to clean up followed by a plumber - you couldn't ask for more. There are excellent restaurants near by and plenty of small shops, a multitude of different ways to get to the city centre and a regular free shuttle service. If you thought you had booked on Nathan road then you would be disappointed, but the hotel never said that they were! The price of the room well made up for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Normal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie_around_the_wor
Reviews.Content: It was two days and one night in this hotel. Building is new and comfortable, but its location isn't very comfortable. Breakfast was 3+, on my opinion not very tasty. There's no adapter in some rooms, but there are safe, conditioner, hairdryer, kettle, teabags, toothbrushs, slippers. Shattle to the centre is full of hotel guests, there are queues, especially for the last two races from centre to hotel. The room is little, standart. The shower drain make you feel on the Titanic. We disliked either the way hotel personal have saved our luggage after check-out: they just have put it out to the hotel bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a not so great area”
Reviews.Author: Mollycat13
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Harbour Plaza as an add on to the Travelsphere China Tour. After to 30 min transfer from the airport we arrived at the hotel, as you leave the centre and drive towards the area you will see a lot of buildings in a state of dis-repair. The area around the hotel is for the locals with restaurants, shops and street stalls, nothing for tourists but you won't have a problem if you just fancy a stroll. The hotel is very modern, clean, bright and stands out like a sore thumb from the surrounding buildings. Our room was not very big but had all the facilities you needed, was in good decorative order and very clean. Shower room was small but well fitted and modern. We had a room on the 2nd floor facing the main street but did not have a problem with noise as everything in the area closes down about 8.00pm and did not get going again till about 9.00am next morning. The hotel had 5 lifts meaning one was always available in a few minutes, did not dine at the hotel but did get a coffee and toastie from the coffee shop in the lobby for about £4. The hotel runs a free bus service into the centre which leaves about every 15mins and runs like clockwork. We bought an Octopus card from the customer services desk in the underground (£15.00) which allows you to travel on all forms of transport in Hong Kong, including the star ferry. At the end of your holiday simply take them back to any service desk and they will refund you whatever is left on the card. (In the 3 days we used ours I spent about £7 and that was traveling everywhere) You will do a tour on your first day which is a must. Peter your guild will have you in tears of laughter and takes you on a San-Pan boat ride, visits a silver factory and give you time in Stanley with its large street market full of bargains and bars. Eat at Outback’s Steakhouse just across the road from where the bus drops you off (cheap drinks before 7.30pm and great food) Don't both with the Irish bars as their way overpriced. Good reasonably priced bars and restaurants in the Wan Chai area, western style bars and restaurants either side of the long escalator which runs up Cochrane Street (Get off the tram at Central Market) Wednesday night is racing at Happy Valley, £1 to get in, only £1 to bet if you like, £3.50 a pint of Steller, we had a great time and comes highly recommend. Temple Street market is great (does not start till 7.30pm, every night) Avenue of the Stars is OK, 8.00pm harbour lazer show is not that good. Hong Kong Museum of history was quite good to spend a few hours in and Time Sq was worth a look. Would stay at this hotel again if visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Hongkong”
Reviews.Author: wendy k
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days in the Harbour Plaza as a stop over on my way to Australia....the room was comfortable....with small sitting area and bedroom...also tea/coffee making etc ..The toilet and shower were clean and modern....the staff were friendly....and very helpful when it came to asking directions etc....the breakfast catered for all nationalities. There was a shuttle bus running back for forth to the town..of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel...but for shopping etc then the bus is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Mmmhhh well OK ….”
Reviews.Author: YogaBless
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel people are very helpful, clean, nothing special and easy access to/from town by the hotel shuttle bus (7 minutes). Sure I will love to return to Hong Kong but not necessary to the same hotel. As there are many other option for the same budget.

Reviews.Title: “Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geoffstravels
Reviews.Content: We were booked in this hotel by our travel agent as a stopover prior to joining our world cruise leg Feb 03-06 2012. I have noted this appears to be the situation with other travellers. Do the agents get a big discount from the hotel? We found taxi's from Kowloon centre were only a few dollars so staying out late in the 24 hour city was not a problem. The location is out of the way and like other travellers we used the free mini bus. Don't be late! We did not spend much time in the room so although the view was not good it was no great downfall. The room was clean and tidy and we found the staff helpful. I considered an average rating when comparing this to other worldwide hotels as we had no experience of other Hong Kong hotels.

Reviews.Title: “OK if in transit”
Reviews.Author: amigo4lavida
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by our travel agent for 4 days after disembarking part of a world cruise sector. The hotel whilst of an acceptable standard is definitely not in an area suited to rookie tourist like our selves. This was our first experience staying in Hong Kong and was spoilt by the location of the hotel. We were very much in a trades area with a recycling depot being the view from our room. Whilst there was a shuttle bus into down-town Kowloon and taxis plentiful this was just not the experience we wanted. There was also a lack of public rooms so if you didn't want to camp out in your room you felt you were making a nuisance of yourself at the small Cafe in reception if you were not purchasing copious cups of coffee. Saying all that the rooms were acceptable and the service friendly. The fault lay with our TA putting us in a hotel that was unsuitable for purpose. Whist we were there there were very good deals to be had and I am quite sure for many it would be-perfectly acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cartref
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique hotel in its design. The 8 degrees in its name refers to the sloping counters and door frames in the reception which give you the impression that the floor is also sloping which is not. Very cleverly done. We had a very efficient and warm welcome following the long flight from London. Our room was very spacious with a separate lounge area with a pleasant view overlooking some residential gardens. I believe the hotel had upgraded our accommodation. We had TV's in both rooms! It was very clean and the bed very comfortable. I cannot fault the accommodation in any way. As we were on a "room only" basis we were offered a package at a reasonable cost to include breakfast, unlimited wi-fi, the use of a private lounge for coffee and snacks during the day (including afternoon tea) on an upper floor. The location of the hotel was not a problem. Although the hotel is not in the centre of Kowloon, the hotel provides a very good mini bus service every half hour. There was also a taxi waiting outside the entrance most of the time if we needed one. The breakfast buffet was very extensive, covering a multitude of Nationalities preferences. The evening buffet, likewise, was also very extensive. There was also an a la carte menu to choose from. We were very impressed by the staff who were very polite and helpful. Nothing was too much for them. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong 2012”
Reviews.Author: Chesterella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Plaza 8 degrees from 3/03-11/03. Our room was on the 11th floor with a very nice outlook over a room garden and the pool.The staff were fantastic, very helpful and cheerful. We made use of the shuttle to take us to TST daily which was excellent. I agree with others that the location is fine if you catch taxis or the bus. We ate in the hotel restaurant and the food was fine, not falsh or overly expensive. We bought coffee and croissants from the cafe each morning and they were great. There is a small supermarket nearby, a fruit stall and a good bakery .We visited friends in Wanchai on several days, the staff printed off a map for the 101 bus and told us where to catch it and which stop to get off. Overall, we were very happy with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent visit”
Reviews.Author: WallyPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: The unusual design of the foyer (8 degrees theme) was made welcoming by the extremely helpful staff who were always available to help with any questions. The tour desk being very knowledgable and helpful. Our room was comfortable with a pleasant view over some residential gardens where we could watch the locals exercise while we enjoyed our morning cup of tea. Situated in a busy residential area meant there were many restaurants to choose from. Although the hotel provided a shuttle bus to various destinations the public bus service allowed easy access to the main ferry terminal and beyond. Taxis were a cheap option as there were 4 of us travelling together. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frostify
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the fuss is about with the location of this hotel. It's a great location. there is buss at the door that takes you to the Star Ferry. it's 35HKD taxi to HungHom MTR station, so all in all it's a nice location. I liked the neighborhood, it was in my mind, authentic, a local area that you don't see behind all the glitz and glamor. there was from the looks a beautification project on for some of the buildings. I stayed here back in 2010 and will be staying here for 8 nights in december this year. It had great service, nice rooms, 10 out of 10 in my books

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Eddie G
Reviews.Content: If you want a good hotel, and don't want to pay big hotel prices, this is ideal It's not in a great tourist area, but buses and taxis are cheap in Hong Kong, and I really enjoyed the hotel. The room was bigger and better equipped than others I have stayed in and paid a lot more for. There is a bus stop right outside the front door and it takes you to the star ferry, every 15 minutes. There is also a hotel shuttle bus, but I never needed to use it. The front entrance is a real feature. |It is an optical illusion that makes you think you are walking down hill. An amazing piece of architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: TheDreamHome
Reviews.Content: No complain at all...we were just there to sleep & so far, we enjoyed our stay & the room was so nice for the three of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay..”
Reviews.Author: NanCLSalvatore
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my 4days stayed in this Hotel.. Room are clean, staff are friendly and helpful, great Coffee served at the Lobby, not a perfect location to catch public transport but we're very pleased that they provide Bus shuttle to the MTR. Overall we're very happy.

Reviews.Title: “affordable for a reason”
Reviews.Author: tomasvdb
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for business and this was my first time in HK (Jan 2012). The hotel had been booked for me so I didn't know what to expect. First impression was a bit disappointing as the hotel is not very central, and the area around it has a lot of car mechanics' shops etc so it doesn't look very inviting. The hotel looks a lot like a transit hotel with a small lobby, packed with people. My room was technically a double but doesn't offer much in terms of space, so don't share it with people you're not 100% comfortable with. My biggest gripe as a business traveller is that wifi is charged per device (not per room) and i couldn't even get a signal in my room. My advice would be to go out and buy a prepaid SIM for a small fee and get unlimited 3G data that way. Once I got over my initial annoyances the hotel was OK, the rooms were clean and quiet and beds comfortable. To get around, the hotel offers a complimentary shuttles bus to the city centre, but at these buses can be very full so don't count on getting a seat in the morning or evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lzl25
Reviews.Content: The room and interior is very nice and clean. I stayed in a Harbour suite and although small, very good value for Hong Kong. The staff are friendly. The lobby is quite small and took a while to check out as it was quite busy. The location is reasonably close to major centers by taxi. Will consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very average, not in a nice part of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: HarringEH999
Reviews.Content: Nothing disasterous hindered our stay, however I am very there are nicer hotels than this one, at the same price. The area was pants, so we were in taxis (which was inexpensive however I'd rather have been elsewhere). Rooms were comfortable and clean, but small and the bathroom was quite teeny. Staff were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Ask for all charges before signing a contract”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: The 8 degrees quotes you one price and then inches up that price untill it's 30% higher. We were quoted a monthly Serviced Suite rate of HK$24,000 at an special Early bird rate. Then told later that we had to pay a Peak season fee that ate up the savings. Then we were told that we had to pay extra for internet access. When it came time to sign the contract, they put in the contract that service cost extra. For a serviced Suite? What? So by the time all of these additional charges were added up, the cost was over HK$31,000. About a 30 %. increase.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: trev1865
Reviews.Content: possibly the best hotel i have stayed in. asked for high room and got 20th floor with spectacular views. breakfast dinner and high tea all nice.(curry for breakfast choice took a bit of getting used to) staff very helpful please dont worry about location the local area is fascinating and regular free shuttle bus plus local cheap bus service covers your needs. room lovely and large by hk standards uk sport including premiership and champions league shown live in your room taxis so cheap less than 8 quid from honk kong island (wanchai has cheap uk pubs)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Plaza 8 Degrees Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mckenndk
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel to stay in, the location is not the best as there is no local MTR station but they provide a mini bus service to two stations and accross the road from the Kowloon Hotel. The rooms are very nice, I was on the 20th floor of the front of the hotel which looks over residential housing and businesses, I liked the site as to me it is more of the real Hong Kong and not what you would see in the Business District of buildings built within the last 10 years. If you get a room on the back of the hotel you will only get a view of a set of apartment buildings that tower above the 22 floor hotel so as for the front if possible. I had dinner once in their restaurant which was ok but just remember that they will also charge you an extra 10% on top as a service fee. There are plenty of places to get dinner around the hotel (they provide a map in the room book or you can print it off their website) ,a few supermarkets and 7-11's so no need to buy from the mini bar. About 10-15min walk away they also have open markets selling everything from cloths to live fish. The swimming pool is unheated so it is best for going between it and the sauna in the colder seasons when its open. The laundry service was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: YuliaNZ
Reviews.Content: The prices in Hong Kong are extremely high so this one offers quality and comfort without charging too much. This is all you need after a long-haul flight. The staff are flexible and helpful. I was offered late check-out and early check-in, which was very nice of them. It is not within the walking distance from all the happening places but they offer a free shuttle which is frequent and fast. The only disadvantage is the time that it takes to get to and from sightseeing tours cause you're the first to be picked up and the last to be dropped off so you'll have to wait for everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ibaloiLaTrinidad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the old hongkong airport at kowloon and offers free shuttle service to their visitors . once you enter the hotel the posts and floor seem like it is tilted 8 degrees! such a tricky architectural design .. the buffet breakfast is great.. the room is clean and the bathroom is spacious . we stayed for 3 nights and had a very comfortable and pleasant stay .

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant eight day holiday”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh46
Reviews.Content: We spent eight days at the Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees and found the hotel rooms to be very clean and well equipped - we stayed in a Deluxe Room. The staff were really polite and helpful and we had no language problems. The swimming pool is very nice and if you are up to it there is a perfectly adequate fitness centre. The hotel is situated away from downtown and the MTR stations but with the hotel shuttle bus, cheap taxis and local buses, getting around is easy. The only reason we haven't given a higher rating is the high cost of drinks in the bars (draft beer £8 per pint). We actually used a hotel about 10 minutes away by taxi for eating out in the evenings as drink and food prices were much more reasonable. The "8 degree" feature in the foyer takes some getting used to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RKK1
Reviews.Content: I visited the Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees for two weeks in January 11 and was blown away by the standard of this hotel. The rooms were very clean, fresh and contemporary. The hotel staff were very pleasant and made me feel comfortable. I would strongly recommend this hotel to business travellers as it is in a good location (10 minutes from the habour front and 15 mins from tsim sha tsui).

Reviews.Title: “think twice before choosing this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coffee_Bean6
Reviews.Content: The hotel's appearance is quite good trying to match international standards but the ratio of problems and facilities is 1:4. the garden terrace bar and pool side is very gud but there is heavy language problem and food problems specially for Indians, sum of the house keeping staff is rude, certain weird rules exist like one must keep a security deposit for using the mini bar else it'll remain locked. AND THERE IS NO COMPLIMENTARY WATER. So travelers & travel agents plz think twice before choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Good Enough, But Location is Awful”
Reviews.Author: Lachlan72
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel - decent pool. Rooms small but not too cramped - pretty standard for Hong Kong in this price range. Front desk staff surly, not smiling, bordering on rude and not helpful and generally made me feel like I was a burden anytime I asked them something or needed help. Totally inflexible with solving guest problems and I noticed this when listening to them deal with other guests too. Shuttle bus often full and doesn't seem to stick to their published timetable. Location is really bad - near the old Kai Tak Airport - and about 10 minutes in a cab to Nathan Road. However, jump on the 5B double decker bus outside the door to the Star Ferry terminal for a leisurely sightseeing trip if you have time. Buffet breakfast was extensive and really good. NOTE: They don't accept debit cards here for a guarantee - even if its a VISA or MASTERCARD debit card which is crazy. Probably safer for them to use this than a credit card! Made checking in a completely painful experience. I've never found a hotel anywhere with a similar polcy that doesn't accept debit cards - madness!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: Luisy2311
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated outside town, smacked right in the middle of a residential neighborhood and industrial car parts area. It's great if you want to experience local style living, going to nearby dimsum shops for breakfast, etc. However, if you've planned your activities around town, it's probably wiser to choose another hotel (Maybe YMCA?). 8 Degrees do have shuttle services to town and Kowloon airport express station. I personally found it tiring to explore Hongkong and having to go all the way back to that 1 meeting point at Tsim Sha Tsui for the shuttle buses. We had a free upgrade to the 1 bedroom suite which had a living area and kitchen. I did a peek into the normal rooms and they look much spacious than the suite in terms of walking area. Service staffs were curt but quick (Front desk only). Depending on your luck, housekeeping either take 1 hour or 5 minutes. Drinking water in hotel is extremely expensive. They only provide 1 bottle of 350ml daily, any more bottles are chargeable. (Although there's 2 of us in the room) I would suggest taking a trip down to the neighborhood's supermarket to stock up your drinking supply. If you ever decide to pack food into the room, do remember to take disposable fork/knife from the food stall. I tried requesting a fork from housekeeping and they wanted to charge me HKD 5 for a disposable plastic fork. I find it ridiculous to pay for a plastic fork when other hotels I've been to just bring up their metal forks from the restaurant. Do note your bill will consist of extra 10% of your room rate for housekeeping charges. Overall, hotel is cheaper for a similar hotel in town area but I would like to try out other hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: VIBHUTIANAND
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in two rooms at 25th floor.This hotel is very good.Plus point about this hotel is that the shuttle bus service is complementry for market Nathen Road at a intervel of 15 minutes. only minus point about this hotel is that the bath room is small and not fitted with any bathtub etc.Hotel is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vishamrit
Reviews.Content: My wife and me stayed in the Harbour Plaza 8 Degrees in Oct 2011. The hotel was good. The people were cooperative. They have a good coffee shop wherein the buffet breakfast was excellent. It is located at close proximity to TST which is main shopping hub in Kowloon. It is also a short bus ride away from Causeway Bay and Times Square. Good Service, Well located and overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay for a upper-middle class”
Reviews.Author: arul p
Reviews.Content: This is a compact hotel. Its comfortable and located at the Kowloon area. Its got a nice big pool and the dinner buffet being hosted definitely looks exquisite. You can try all the exotic chinese cuisine, including the fast depleting and ill-famous Shark fin soup. the cafe downstairs serves awesome pastries. Everyone knows English, so no issues there.

Reviews.Title: “The last occupants loved it so much ~ a used condom was left behind!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine M
Reviews.Content: hotel in hong kong How can I write this without getting sick....again!?  Especially by the hotel managements' speculation that I may have planted this (ugh) used condom just under the foot of the bed makes me sick.  Management says, "We have the "utmost" cleaning supervisor that double checks the rooms before the next occupancy!  Who is going to be believed!!??"   AAAGH!! My first visit to Asia, spent 30 days in 5star hotels throughout China (which I at first believed to be lesser quality than Hong Kong)  Wrong!!!  Throughout China trip (great 5 star hotels) the only complaint I had was the one place we stayed in a 3 star and that was not adequate.  (rusty bathtub).  This particular hotel, Harbor Plaza, which is my first night in HongKong at an unbelievable $3500HKD (or $468CDN) was the most I have ever paid.  Nothing else was available in the district so I had to take it.  I understand their speculation (about the price paid maybe) but if they contacted ALL the hotels I have stayed at OR the people who I have socialized & done business with while there (top business/government officials) there would be no such speculation or the "felt" accusation of my word against theirs.    The ONLY compensation they would give was extended room check-out for 6 more hours, and $500HKD which equates to $65CDN.  (this was after dickering on full and half refunds).  To me it wasn't about the money at this point as I told them I would give that money to charity in Thailand after their floods have taken the homes of friends there who are even without food & water. Bad location, but a probable needed hotel to spiff up area. Comparable hotel and garden/pools to beautiful 5 stars in China.  Room service was good, food not so much (had American Breakfast). otherwise modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, surroundings not pleasant”
Reviews.Author: HermJP
Reviews.Content: The hotel 's surroundings are not very nice but once you are inside its ok. The rooms have modern furniture, are not too big with good LCD TV and bathrooms. Shuttle bus is useful to the main mtr stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base”
Reviews.Author: amf734
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides an excellent base ,it's clean and comfortable. The staff are excellent friendly, helpful and polite. It is easy to get out and about from this hotel experiencing local life along the way. The coffee shop on the foyer is an added bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Ella Y
Reviews.Content: Having not travelled overseas for a while , I left my hotel bookings to a travel agent recommended by family. Once she sent me my itinerary, I browsed through the hotel's website and read through the reviews posted here to know what to expect. I didn't arrange for early check-in (didn't think of it), but there was no problem. The staff were friendly, courteous and efficient. I was in a "superior" room (entry level) with a queen size bed. The room was a fair size and the bathroom small-to-mid size with a bath/shower. The room came with large-screen TV, adjustable air-con, minibar fridge etc. Both room and bathroom were clean when I arrived and clean when I returned from my tourism stints. Breakfast was a buffet. I didn't have any of the cooked options, but there was yogurt, fresh fruit and a fairly large selection of pastries and breads. Some reviews mentioned the hotel's position as being unfavourable. Having read this, I downloaded the hotels shuttle schedule from their website (unnecessary as they gave me a copy when I checked in). If you are prepared, there are no real problems. There are two routes. One stops at Hung Hom station and both stop opposite Kowloon Hotel near Nathan Road, near an entrance to the East Tsim Sha Stui Station. Only once did I miss the shuttle and the next one arrived 10 minutes later. While I only require a comfortable "base of operations" when I travel, I would be quite happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajann
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel, located within walking distance of shops, restaurants, bus stops. Food was good, rooms really nice. Good value for money especially for business travellers. Staff were helpful, courteous. Bus service available to the train station from the hotel lobby

Reviews.Title: “It was Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: archana54
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff is extremely helpful and corteous. The vegetarian food needs some variety . The menu for vegetarians is the same everyday. Otherwise the Hotel is very comfortable and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not great, but the hotel is okay”
Reviews.Author: canadagrl77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Plaza 8 Degrees for 3 nights before returning home after our trip to China and Hong Kong. Located in Kowloon, there is not too much around the hotel and it is a 30 minute walk to the MTR station, so we opted for the double decker buses to get us to the spots we wanted to see. The views from the hotel aren't great but you can see what life in Kowloon is really like inside small flats across the way and the little street markets that pop up during the day. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast one morning but the food options were a bit limited for me, since i am on a gluten-free diet. My boyfriend loved the coffee here: "Just like home!" The small size of the room really surprised me at first. The bathroom was not much bigger than that on the airplane, with a stand-up shower added in. However, the beds were soft, the room was clean and cool, and it was the quietest hotel we stayed in over the past two weeks ... we didn't hear a single sound all night which made for a very restful sleep. The beds were soft and we asked for an extra pillow because the softness of those provided was a bit too much - but a third pillow each made sleep very easy. The staff was helpful. We used the business centre twice to confirm our flights and check emails. It was pricey but worth it for its convenience. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean place, slightly out of the way though...”
Reviews.Author: mattSingapore
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended me this place which initially I mistook it for the one opposite Hung Hom station. Room is pretty nice and clean, just that the environment is pretty quiet there is nothing much to do at night around the area. Location is a little far off the train stations but there is a pretty reliable shuttle bus service. Do note no standing is allowed in the minibus and if the bus is full you have to think of other options to get around to town.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have stayed here if I'd known about the location”
Reviews.Author: bahumbug225
Reviews.Content: This is not in a good location by any means. If I'd read these reviews earlier, I would not have stayed here. On the positive side, the rooms are clean, the breakfast service was decent. The check in process was awful. We had asked for an early checkin, which they neither confirmed or denied, and we had to wait for 3 hours before the rooms were ready. There's a "hospitality room" in the parking bay, which stinks of diesel fumes. No water, no restroom. The AC didn't work initially and we needed to become obnoxious before anything happened to fix it. The rooms were tiny, and the bathrooms tinier. Absolutely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel rooms, clean, good service, free shuttle...”
Reviews.Author: fruittie
Reviews.Content: first time to HK and this hotel was selected as it was a new hotel. contrary to what others have said, this hotel shines thru the 'dilapidated housing estates area' in Mok Cheung Street, where it was located. we wanted to experience real hk and this hotel is located right in a estate housing area, you see old flats mixed with new condos, its a high contrast, very interesting. hotel is near a 7-eleven, many char chan teng (eateries) around, just walk from the entrance right ahead is the row of market selling fruits and u'll get to another open road where there's a Gong Cha (bubble tea shop) and supermarket, and many other electrical, household, beauty bath products, some shoe stores. many buses around to get everywhere. tip: download android app called 'hongkong explorer' and you'll be taking buses from mongkok to your hotel and back in a juffy. its just too easy! the hotel offers daily shuttle bus (aircon) approx every 15-30mins, it goes to Hung Hom MTR or to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR, right in the spot of SHOPPING. the first bus starts approx 8 or 9am, the last being 11.45pm. as said, you can take a bus from nathan rd back to the hotel. its too easy to get around. very very convenient. the rooms were cleaned daily, its big, our twin room had ample space to walk (we aren't expecting big spaces so the space of half a queen bed is good enough for us) between beds, toilet, tv.. a big plasma tv with cable, fresh towels and sheets everyday. internet & wifi internet are chargeable or free depending on your package. the staff speak good english, are polite and helpful. oh, the room has a safe and mini fridge with daily free bottled water. oh, the rooms are quite, you don't hear pple walking by or etc. we stayed on the 18th flr. the hotel has 22 or 23 flrs. stayed there for 4 nights and i really think this hotel made hongkong very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location, will not choose it”
Reviews.Author: MeowSG
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying 3 nights at this hotel. It is super far from any tourist/shopping area; smack in-front of the hotel is a wet market street selling vegetable, fruits, meat, fish & sundries from morning till afternoon, to the right is a big building dealing in car spares part. Not the most idea spot for a hotel. No MTR nearby, a cab to nearest subway took 20 mins travel time and cost around HK$40-60. The free shuttle is totally useless as it run at 1 hour interval to Hunghom MTR/ Tsimshatsui (opp Kowloon hotel). Most of the time u are not able to board the mini bus as it's full, u need to be 20/30 min standing in the queue in order to be grantee a seat as the hotel is pack with China, Taiwan & Indian tourist. Another free shuttle route is to Kowloon Bay MTR, but this one only run once in the early morning & evening; what a waste as this stop is where Telford plaza is, a huge shopping complex. From Kowloon Bay MTR you could also catch the free shuttle provide by MegaBox shopping mall. Cross the street in front of hotel and on yr left is a money changer whose sign board is so small u miss it most of the time, the egg roll shop next to it is nice, can try. There's a 7-eleven down the street; walk till the end of the wet market street, turn right there's 2 super market (ParknShop & Vanguard), 1 Watson & Manning store. Walk further and there's a few Chinese cafe/restaurant. Hotel lobby is very small and always pack full of people, hotel room size is ok by HK standard. Carpet n bedding are all very clean n new, the bed was comfortable, no stain on carpet; luckily our bathroom comes with a bathtub, those opposite our room (815) don't and the shower area is small. The digital air-con control in the room is great, after some adjustment it operates at the temperature that I prefer so that I could have a good night rest. The only complain I have for the room is that it had too many mirrors, a total of 8 pcs including the one in the bathroom! A strange issue is the mini-bar, it's locked! If u need to use it u got to call front office n they will sent the house keeping staff to open it, than the lady simply remove all item from it! Nothing is left for u to consume even if u are willing to pay for it! There's a plastic tag that say "complimentary water" but I never see any bottle water in the room for us. Guys, pls bring yr shaving kit as none is been provided. Ladies, yr body lotion as none is been provided as well. The front office, bell man & housekeeping department is great, courteous with a smiling face always willing to help at all time, that cannot be said for the cafe staff, all have grumpy look, no one ever greet you “Good morning” when u enter for breakfast, that’s including the reception & restaurant manager. This department definitely need to pull-up its sock. One of our tour mate actually lost a tote bag in the cafe when she just left her table for 5 mins, luckily for her it’s not something of value, just a water bottle she bought the day before. :) I would not recommend people to stay here (if u are on free & easy) as it's a far distance to anywhere; even tho the advert say they are in Kowloon City. Transport & the hotel surrounding is a major factor; it's a dead town by 10pm, not a single soul on the road, we only met one couple walking their dog. We walk past a few eateries which are open but there will be a language barrier if u don't speak Cantonese/Mandarin. Not an area for shopping, it’s more residential + auto parts/hardware shop. Do spent a few dollars more on somewhere which is more convenient, the amount save on room will just be channel to transport.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient location, but hotel itself is very nice.”
Reviews.Author: turtlez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the site of the old Hong Kong airport. To see or do any of the things that you probably are in Hong Kong to do, you need to take a taxi or use the hotel's shuttle. The shuttle is free and convenient, but sometimes full. Taxis in HK are inexpensive. Not being in a more convenient location detracted from my HK experience and I would pick a different hotel next time. The hotel itself is very nice. An interesting feature is the smallish lobby which is built on an 8 degree slant. It made me dizzy! The rooms are well done, but small. The bathroom is very small and compact. Internet was not free and wifi was not available in the rooms, which I found to be inconvenient. The restaurant served a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good thing I didn't listen to those on tripadvisor who didn't like it.”
Reviews.Author: KyTheGuy
Reviews.Content: Checking in was quite fast and efficient, bell boy was quick and helpful as well. The room was nice and clean, the bed was very comfortable. Swimming pool was nice and big, I didn't have a chance to check out their gym room. Morning breakfast buffet was decent, with an average selection. Complimentary shuttle bus was super efficient and on time with approximately a 15 minutes ride to the STS tourist shopping district. The area around the hotel have a 7/11, laundry mate, and local shops and eatery, these businesses caters more to the locals around the area. I guess the only down side of this hotel is that internet is not complimentary. Overall my wife and I is very satisfy with this hotel, we would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for value. Spectacular pool.”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the harbour 8 degrees for a few nights back in May. we had come from HK proper and were expecting a similar sortof thing. We were wrong! The hotel had very courteous door staff, a nice open lobby, a beautiful dinner buffet with all you can drink for about 70HKD (well worth the money), a great and full gym (one of the best I experienced on my month long trip through SE asia including the 4 seasons/fullerton etc). Pool was spectacular. Huge, nice fountains/water falls, nice jacuzzi. A little chilly so could use a hot tub but otherwise perfect! Oh yeah had to pay for internet...only two computers... Overall GREAT hotel for cost.

Reviews.Title: “A forgetable experience”
Reviews.Author: Amarkhanolkar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on recommendation of "Make my trip" from 7th to 9th May. We were told that the rooms are comparable with 4* category. We were a group of 9 adults+4 kids+2 infants. The room (room 248) given to me was so small, there was barely space to even keep the luggage with a single door wardrobe, no locker. All this when we had specifically told that we would be accompanied by kid of 8 years. Thought of asking for an extra bed, unfortunately the only place they would have put it was in the washroom. Couple of us got slightly better rooms; thank god more rooms in this category were not available. The washroom sink has a tap which is barely reachable (placed lower than the sink on the backside). The mini-bar was locked & it took them a good 1 hour to send somebody to unlook same. The hospitality experience in the restaurant was just as bad. The only saving grace was the breakfast which was nice & the swimming pool. Have travelled a lot & I would still count this as a most forgetable experience. If you are on a pleasure trip, please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “OK OK HOTEL BECAUSE OF THEIR LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: bafnaparesh
Reviews.Content: this hotel's price was cheaper, hotel room was ok as like all other hk hotels ( small rooms), location was very bad, but they give free shuttle to tsim sha tsui so it was ok with this location. IF YOU WANT HOTELS IN LOW RATE NEAR TSIM SHA TSUI AND KOWLOON THEN ITS GOOD

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Lobby and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: tinchantilly
Reviews.Content: Yes...the location is away from it all but this also means it is quiet and a cheap cab fare away from the sights. There was no king bed when we arrived but they said they would take care of it. Our luggage and a lady arrived just after we walked in our room. We left the lady in our room to take care of the bed wondering if it was going to be comfortable. We were pleasantly surprised that the bed was fantastic - as was the shower (water pressure and temperature). I am guessing we had an "executive" room - it was large but on a lower floor. The concierge staff were incredible. We told them we wanted a "local" breakfast. They directed us across the street (even wrote down in Chinese what we might like to order) and sent us on our way to a nice and inexpensive place. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was very good but three days of that was enough. We took the free shuttle once. Every seat was full - I don't think everyone made it on so some guests had to wait for the next shuttle. Our big American bottoms didn't fit too well on the smallish bus seats! The pool was not scheduled to open for a couple of weeks. Looks pretty.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is quite nice but not its locatiion”
Reviews.Author: suathong
Reviews.Content: We visited Hong Kong quite frequently during the past decade, but this was our first stay in this hotel. It is a new hotel in a dilapidated neighhood. There are many shops and restaurants nearby. Since we speak Mandarin and Cantonese, we had no problems venturing the neighborhood. The room is of a decent size by Hong Kong standard. The main drawback of the hotel is its location. The nearest subway station in Mongkok is 2 km away. The hotel does provide free shuttle bus service to Tsimshatsui and Hunghom MTR station at an interval of 20-40 minutes, with occasional services to Airpot Express Kowloon Station. Boarding the bus at the hotel is not a problem as there is a staff to maintain order. It is a different story at the pick-up point in TST. Guests rush to get in the bus. If you can't get in, you can wait for the next bus and try your luck. Or else, you can take a taxi back to the hotel; the fare is around HKD40 (not bad for a party of 2-4). If the hotel is nearer to any of the MTR stations along the Nathan Road, I would give it a 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “NEWLY BUILT WITH FREE BUS SERVICE - HIGHLY RECCOMENDED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: chiten
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccomend this hotel - sue to the fact its new and its more than you expect - very good service & free bus service to the downtown and station. the location is not in the town but the free shuttle just does it as its very often and drops you /picks you from Nathan Road (downtown Kawloon) flat screens in each room adn reccomend to stay on top floor as the views are just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor choice of hotel for either business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DrWei
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very much isolated (no acceptable restaurant in the general area), about one hour away from the airport by a poorly organized shuttle bus (HKD 130), far from any MTR (HK subway) station. Going there, and going anywhere from there will cost you money and time. if you factor that in, it is much better to invest the extra HKD 300 that a daily taxi trip for two from the airport and your (at least once daily) round trip into town will cost you. We had booked a King size bed, and got two single beds, which we had to put together ourselves, since the staff never came to the room to help or to put something on the mattresses to avoid the gap between. We asked for a heater, as it was very cold in HK and the A/C does not have a heating setting. The heater never came. Anything you may want to do means having to go down to the front desk and queue up for 20 minutes, as the staff is not very well trained (although quite friendly). Another thing is that the rooms, however clean and nice, have no view on anything but a highway for the luckiest guests. Bath tubs are quite small. The options for foot or body massage around the hotel are not very appealing (not very clean), and the spa in the hotel is substandard. The reason why we chose this hotel is that the gym seemed very nice. In fact, the equipment is not very good, even by HK hotel standards. Also, the gym is used as an extra ball room, and there was a marriage going on in it on the day we got there. the equipment was moved aside and there were tables set in the middle. Very festive indeed... There would not be any using the gym on that day, of course. The hotel's options for food are limited, not very good and quite expensive. There are no seats in the foyer area, unless you want to have a coffee at the local espresso bar. And this is not good coffee. There is a 7-Eleven nearby, though, but I guess that there is no place in HK sufficiently isolated not to have a convenience store within a 300 feet radius. Finally, the hotel is packed with very noisy and poorly educated tourists from the mainland, who seem to spend their days roaming the corridors shouting obscenities in Chinese (mostly complaining about the service, which is quite amusing). This means that the hotel management must have some agreement with a state-owned travel agency in China. This also means that you will have to fight for a taxi and will be pushed in and out of elevators. I would give a wide berth to this hotel. It is a very poor choice for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: HappySp00n
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is such far from almost everything. We went to Hong Kong for more than 10 times but this is no-where hotel. Once we arrived the hotel, we suddenly planned to move out. Although the hotel is new and looks sophisticated but it's just the surface. We made the reservation online, it said we're supposed to pay about HKD5,000 for six nights during christmas holidays. yes, sound good but once we checked-in, the reception asked for more HKD3,000 for guarantee. It was so weird to ask for that big money. They insisted to get 3,000 more eventhough we were about to pay the whole expenses then. No clear explanation for this. The next day, we asked for a set of plate and fork, they normally had one set in the room for some fruits. The housekeeping informed us that they would bring the paper plate and plastic fork with charge. The quality of service was also not consistant. Some room had bath robe but some didn't. I agree with other comments to pay a bit more in order to get much better than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's good, but the location is a minus.”
Reviews.Author: ojicon
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but it's clean and nice. Same for the bathroom. Breakfast was average, I've had better. The location is not really ideal for backpacker or those who travels in a small group, since it's located in, I don't even know. It's not somewhere far from civilization or anything, I think it's a business district, but a quiet, old one.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but situated out of town”
Reviews.Author: TWinster13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is OK - but certainly not cheap (few hotels are cheap in Hong Kong !). It is located in an old residential area near the old airport - many of the surrounding buildings are derelict. There are many local shops and restaurants within walking distance - these are good value but its difficult to find a menu in English, and the shop prices are generally negotiable !! English is not so widely spoken nowadays, so discussions can be tricky. I did not find a bar within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus every hour to the MTR stations & the tourist shopping area of Tsim Sha Tsui - which is really useful. The fitness room in the hotel exists - but is very basic. There is also a pool, but it was closed in December. The one complaint I had was that on two nights I stayed there they had private functions. This meant that the bar was closed to residents (which the hotel did not mention at check--in). So there was nowhere to go to go to work outside the small bedroom,or to relax after a day of sightseeing or shopping. Overall, I reckon its better to stay in the tourist area of Kowloon, which seem much more "visitor friendly".

Reviews.Title: “Smelly nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Fortino74
Reviews.Content: I have been booking this hotel with my wife initially because of a very good offer publicized on the hotel website, we knew Hong Kong pretty well and being away from downtown wasn't a turn down point for us. Problems began prior our arrival when we had to anticipate our vacation to a week earlier! We were told that the room rate we chose over the internet was no longer available and we were forced to pay "double" or loose everything! Hotel lobby (rather small) was packed with tour package tourists of the worst kind "if you know what I mean ..." those that come with buses in hordes, screaming and spitting around! Room was just on average with a bathroom quite below the standard! TV guide claimed channels that were actually not available! First night we could not sleep 'till 3:00 a.m. due to a nasty smell that was coming out from the air condition! We insisted with the hotel manager until we were moved to another room (lower floor). Just to find out that the same terrible smell was again there. The following day we complained again and a service guy came to change the air-condition filter, situation did not improve at all and we had to spend another smelly night! Thank God, temperature dropped in Hong Kong and for our last night we could sleep without air condition! No discount nor help was offered by the hotel staff, who was totally unable to face the situation! We had our worst hotel experience ever in Asia! Whoever gave 4 stars to this hotel should seriously consider to change job!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: sternenklar
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night on a business trip to Hong Kong. The hotel is near the airport and they have a shuttle bus to the hotel. I booked online on the hotel website which was easy. Prices where good, especially since there was an exhibition in HK at that time and downtown hotel prices were much higher. Since my selected room type was not available on check-in, I got upgraded to a suite. The rooms are great, bright and with big windows. Room size is not huge but good for HK. The hotel is new and my room had modern decor (design hotel like), a kitchen in the living room, a small bathroom with a shower and a bedroom. All rooms have TV with international channels and pay-tv. All rooms were nice and clean and the hotel provides complimentary drinking water. Broadband internet is available for about 10 eur per day, which will also allow you to use the WiFi around the public areas of the hotel (as everywhere in HK you have to pay for internet). It did take me a while until I found a power plug around the table in the living room and since there is no WiFi in the rooms you are bound to work at the table where there is the only internet cable in the room. The hotel has a pool area, which is a bit tricky to find but otherwise great if you catch nice weather and have the time for a swim. There's a bar and restaurant near the pool and also a fitness center. Another cafe/restaurant is located on the ground floor. I did however not have breakfast or eat there since you will easily find hundreds of opportunities to eat outside on the streets and around HK. Service was really good. Staff is great, very forthcoming and speaks good English (as anywhere in HK). The concierge service will help you find your way around town, should you want to go shopping or sightseeing. The hotel itself is on the Kowloon peninsula, a bit outside, near the new HK airport and the former Kowloon Walled City but you have good connections with the subway to HK's shopping areas, Tsim Sha Tsui, and Central and a taxi is always around the corner to take you downtown in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel but location is out of the nowhere”
Reviews.Author: bizarre98
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with plenty of package travellers. The area is in the middle of an old factory buildings near Kai Tak airport..If i am not mistaken but as said by prevoius traveller they are shuttle bus service to Hung Ham MTR and to TST and Kowlon station. This is handy if you are planning to make a trip to Shenzen and travelling around in Hong Kong by train..

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: tetka
Reviews.Content: SOOO far away. No underground, no alternative transport. The fact that it advertises that it's based in Kowloon is simply a lie. What's worse is that they have booked a wedding in this weekend, which means that there is nowhere to go in the hotel to have a drink. Mini bar has 2 beers in. No bars or shops around. We've booked superior suit, which has two rooms...well, there are two rooms both the size of a small bathroom. The bathroom - well, if you go in, you will not be able to turn around. Concierge said that there is nothing to see in Hong Kong, reception tried to upgrade us to a room that is even smaller (i.e. they have no idea of the size of the rooms). Apparently we are currently in the best room (528) - the curtains need to be shut at all time, as we are overlooked by people in the restaurant. Absolutely crap, do not buy into the cheaper rates - they reflect the crappiness of this hotel. p.s. also do not go for the "city view" - it's a view of broken down buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location not ideal for traveller”
Reviews.Author: patrick8591
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, and found the distance a big problem and would not recomend this to anyone we know. The hotel is nice and situated in an area where nothing is around. i was advised the hotel is designed for a resort like experience except this experience is in siberia.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Nice”
Reviews.Author: XMCobra
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 4 night in 2 twin bed rooms and 1 single bed room with my family on 19th floor. It is new & clean. Small room and see no cooking facility as mentioned in previous reviews in all the 3 rooms we stayed. Of course, maybe some other rooms in other floors. But, the most important thing is, bed sheet and toilet are clean & spotless. Refer to my pictures uploaded. Transportation Public Bus - A22 from airport and get off a Mok Cheong Street. HK$39.00 per person with around 1 hour and 15 minutes. Refer to the hotel's guide card I uploaded, hope it helps. Bus Station -There is a bus station just right behind the hotel taking you to MTR, ferry and downtown. You will find another two station if you go a little bit further. Shuttle Bus - Van leaves hotel every hour and stop at Hunghom MTR station, Near Kowloon Ferry, Airport Express MTR Kowloon Station which is free of charge and very helpful. Taxi - From Hunghom MTR station to hotel is around HK$35.00 for single trip, FYI only. Location Yes, it is isolated and takes around 45 mintues to arrive downtown. But we do not care because we are tourist and have plenty of time. Food Many local food nearby if you go around the hotel. HK$12-19 for a breakfast set HK29 for lunch set You will have many choices if you love Chinese cuisine. WiFi There is NO FREE WiFi, even in lobby! Tips -try use your laptop in the 7-eleven nearby. After I come home,I am told all 7-eleven in Hong Kong offers free WiFi. Never try.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilja016
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for a week in June. The location is as a few have mentioned not great in a fairly run down area and far from the underground. However, the hotel has a shuttle service and taxis are cheap in Hong Kong. I was upgraded to the Club floor, and my room was basic, but at least reasonably sized. Not quite what I would expect from a 4 star, but then the price was also lower than I would expect to pay for a 4 star. Other colleagues complained that their rooms were minute. Breakfast fairly good with a good selection of hot and cold food. There is also an outdoor pool, which was quite pleasant and not too crowded. Overall it was fairly good value for money, but I would rather pay a little more to stay in a different hotel. I would describe it as fair hotel t

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalViDroitwichWorcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights following the end of our 24day CTS China tour - comfortable hotel - food good and reasonably priced - rooms good - saff all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located near to the old airport in Kowloon - not the best of locations - looks run down - but will improve with time - as alot of building going on as in all of kowloon and Hong Kong. Location is good - transport cheap to get you to all the main attractions and shopping areas. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Package good value”
Reviews.Author: dchiu
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for a promotion "flight and accommodation" I probably would not have known or stayed here. Although a cab ride is inexpensive to get here from say Langham place MongKok, I'd prefer to stay somewhere within walking distance to an MTR. The place was clean and comfortable, the twin share room had little distance between beds. Its a relatively new hotel, but it seems like the workmanship of the buliding wasn't the best e.g. joinery between walls and floor, walls and tile, wallpaper etc. these are just my observations and would not stop me from recommending the hotel. The suite was serviced on a daily basis and credit must be passed on to the housekeepers. Nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: JavedAhmed
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Hong Kong. I stayed in this hotel on my return from Macau. Firstly, the rooms are too small. I know that the hotel rooms in hong kong are small but this one was really small. There was no bath tub (4 star???) and the wash room was as small as the room. Try sitting on the commode and you have to figure out how to sit/fix yourself in the small space. Secondly, the hotel surrounding is not good at all. If you like to eat chinese food and want to shop cheap items then you may stay here. The buildings in this area are very old and worn out. The sight of these buildings is actually ugly. The rooms were however neat and clean. Sleeping in the room wasn't bad either. The food quality was just average. I booked an airport drop from the hotel and it turned out to be a bus drop rather than a car drop. On the way to airport, we were shifted in another bus which should have been in the junkyard. I do not recommend this hotel unless you get it free !!!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!! WORST EVER”
Reviews.Author: Wolleydesilva
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I should have checked this site prior to my trip to HK. Arriving in at the hotel, I wasn’t sure if the address and the photos matched to the information listed in the website. Complete disaster.
