Rooms were too small and the hospitality wasn't all that great. Only thing that I could say is that it was a little cheaper compared to the other hotels. My advice is to pay that little extra and stay at a different place since it would save you the trouble and the heartache during your vacation. Worst of all, they charged my credit card without my consent and I only found out when I got the monthly statement. Mind you, this was after the settling all my bills prior to my departure. My advice, find another place even if you had to pay extra.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay; housekeeping staffs are not trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: belleblushes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my first hong kong trip, i agree with other members who commented that the location is not that accessible. we rode a bus from the airport and went down to the designated bus stop station, asked some people where this hotel is located but no one knew where this hotel is. luckily, after many tries, one thai girl helped us and brought us to this hotel. We had the deluxe room, good for three. the room was quite small. the beds were small as well. the bathroom tiles do not dry, we have to wipe it off after every bath or else the entire bathroom would be all wet. Moving on, when we arrived we left all our baggages in the closet, good thing all of them had locks, my guy friend, since he was not able to activate his roaming, decided to leave his phone in the hotel. he placed it on top of his bed. Then later that night when we came back, his phone is nowhere to be found. we searched our luggages and hand carries, and even the under side of our beds but no cellphone. we knew a roomboy/girl entered the room because an additional bed for the third person was added. me and my friend went down to report the issue and talked to one of the front desks, the guy said it wont be possible that one of their staff would take the cellphone since they are not allowed to touch the things of the customers once it is inside the room. he didnt even offer us further investigation. we went up and even though twice and even thrice if the phone was left really in the hotel. my friend was sure about it and even me, because i even saw him opened the phone and see if he'll catch some signal. the next day, we talked to a different receptionist, this time, after asking us the usual questions such as are we sure we left it in the hotel, the make and model of the phone etc. he promised to have it investigated. they said they'll check their cctv and see if someone we dont know entered the room and they will send someone to do a thorough search in the room. when we came back that night around 11pm, manager called us and advised us that no success with the investigation and said the phone could have been lost somewhere. they said they viewed their cctv and no one aside from us entered the room plus the room service. i like to tell her that we knew no other unauthorized person came in the room, it is your room service whom you need to investigate. but then we decided to let it go because we felt nothing would ever get done with this issue and they just had the investigation going so that we wont say that they didnt do anything. on our third day, the manager called us again that night, telling us that they found a nokia phone left in the lobby and we could go ahead and check if it was my friend's. my sister came down to check since the hotel was registered to her name. when she came down, she was told that the phone was found in the hotel's shuttle bus. which is which? and if it is indeed found in the shuttle bus, why would it take 3 days to be recovered? the shuttle bus of the hotel is being used everyday and is running for like every 15minutes. and if it is found in the lobby, its impossible that it will be reported only to them after 3 days since the lobby is always full with people. someone could have found it easily and take it with them or report it immediately to the hotel reception. we knew that they are just covering up their staffs because no other people could access our rooms but them. we are just thankful that the phone was recovered. as to whether i would recommend this hotel to a friend or to anyone, would say no mainly because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you need a quiet sleep!”
Reviews.Author: takadano
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one month. However, the next-door neighbours changed every day. They were from tours from China. These people were very loud, they banged the doors, opened their hotel room doors, shouted to their friends in the opposite hotel room, shouted from one end to the other side of the floor, they smoked in their rooms and in the corridor even in the non-smoking floor. What was worse was that they knocked loudly at your door by mistake at 1 or 5 in the morning ! They pushed you inside the lift even the lift was full! They talked loudly in the lift! It's very hard to believe this "high-class" hotel hosts this type of clients! Moreover, the "fresh" towels were very dirty, full of yellow spots! The faucet was so high that the water spilled every where and wet my clothes! There is no phone on the desk, so if you use the hotel phone by the bedside, you can't use the internet at the same time. The tv is not clear! Don't swim in the pool, I saw the kids with dirty shoes walking beside the pool and washed their shoes in the pool! The location of the hotel is very remote. The hotel shuttle bus only runs till 10pm and it's filled up very quickly. Don't stay here! It will spoil your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Very different, yet enjoyable...”
Reviews.Author: MrMoopy
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is home to the chain of Harbourgrand and Harbour Plaza hotels and which are owned by the same group. I stayed at the new Harbourplaza 8 Degrees in early February 2010 at the end of my business trip in Asia. This hotel's address is 199 Kowloon City Rd, but if you told any taxi driver the address, they will correct you that the entrance is actually on Mok Cheong Street (pronounced Mook Ch-ong guy) in To Kwa Wan, Kowloon. Relatively, the travel agent prices are similar to their website prices, so I decided to book via their website instead. Rooms: Stayed in the City Deluxe room on the 15th floor and there was a king sized bed, a small sofa, coffee table and a huge desk for working on. Bed was comfortable, 4 pillows, sheets were pretty new, and overall the room looked modern and nice and clean. No funny smell noticed, even though I was on a smoking floor. Everything you would find in an hotel room was there, maybe except an ironing board and an iron. There was also enough open space in the room to do maybe 3 tumble turns on the floor for the claustrophobic person. Had a sneek peak at the normal superior rooms, and they looked modern, but quite small, so it's advisable to get the deluxe room there. Now the bad. Cleaning staff and the person who checks each room after the cleanup should actually look under the sofa and clear out the garbage there, as found some leftover stuff behind the toilet and under sofa. Otherwise, everything was quite clean. Internet was around $120 dollars HKD for 24 hours or you could have booked the room with their 2010 promotion from their website which includes internet, where you save $20-100 HKD bucks a day on Internet. Staff: Excellent staff at the door, the reception, the concierge. I checked in early and a Miss Tsang was helpful and friendly. There is nearly always someone to open the door for you, either the side exit or the main entrance, and always greeted you with a smile. Overall, the all the staff in my mind are excellent and comparable to 5 star hotels in Hong Kong. The restaurant staff at the Cafe were also excellent. Well trained, all smiles. Atmosphere: Hotel looks very good overall, gives out a luxury feeling but the area where the hotel is is a very odd one. Industrial, tons of vehicle repair garages and tons of really really old Hong Kong buildings. I do suggest taking photos of this really old area before they tear it down in the future. In the coming years, this area will become much better as many of the old buildings will be eventually torn down to prepare the whole area to be a tourist attraction when cruiseliner docks are completed at the old Kai Tak airport. Around the hotel, there is nothing much to see or eat..... To get to the famed Kowloon city eateries, you will have to trek maybe 10-15 mins to the otherside. Don't expect much outside the hotel. It's like this modern building next to a whole bunch of old industrial buildings. Other reviewers of this hotel obviously have mentioned that outside likes like an eyesore. Transportation: There are no MTR stations near the hotel. That's the only down side of this hotel. All travels can be down by taxi, free hotel shuttle bus, or the public double decker bus right ouside the hotel. If you are taking the taxi from the hotel to somewhere like ladies market in Mongkok, it is going to cost around 50-70 dollars HKD depending on the traffic. (avoid after work hours). Hotel provides free shuttle bus every hour from morning 8am to 10pm on 3 different routes. One route goes to Telford Plaza at Kowloon Bay MTR (green line), another route goes to the Kowloon Hotel at Tsim Sha Tsui, which you can get to the MTR (red line) and the last stop of this route ends at the Kowloon Airport station for the airport. For example, I took the 2pm shuttle, and after picking and dropping other hotel guests, I was at the Kowloon station at 2:30pm. Convenient. I strongly suggest taking the free shuttle as first, its free.... Shopping and Food: There's absolutely nothing to really shop for where the hotel is located. But I did spot a local laundromat near the hotel where you can do laundry by the pound. There are couple very small resturants nearby the hotel, but cater mainly to locals. There is also a 7-11 store on one corner around 2 mins walk from the hotel where you can buy munchies and smokies late at night. Eating right inside the hotel is also a good choice as the food is quite good. Conclusion: Hotel is pretty good for tourists and area may seem old, but safe. May not be suitable for the business intensive guest as it is too far from all the financial areas. For the adventurer and explorer, its actually quite good. Compared to other hotels, the price is actually quite decent for this class of hotel in Hong Kong, but the location is the main drawback as it is not the most convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel set in old style HK”
Reviews.Author: ALU8
Reviews.Content: This new hotel has gorgeous boutique styling. One unique feature is the ground floor which is set on an angle (an optical illusion). Very cool. The rooms are beautiful and I enjoyed the room service and breakfast at the restaurant. The staff are very polite and went out of their way to help us with a broken suitcase. One negative point was the cost of the internet access. 8 Degrees is located near the old airport. I walked around the neighbourhood and saw a side of Hong Kong I had not seen before. It was like getting a peek into the lives of locals. You won't find a McDonald's or Starbucks here. But you'll see wet markets, tiny local shops and lots of pet stores! Also it seems to be a bit of a garage district (lots of car repair shops). Unfortunately there's much not in walking distance to do at night around this area, apart from a couple of restaurants. It was a short taxi ride to many of Kowloon's attractions such as the Ladies' Market. Tsim Sha Tsui is nearby and the hotel shuttle bus goes there.

Reviews.Title: “Caring Staff & Greatest Hotel I Ever Stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: Coolman7528
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms & stayed there during 24th Nov. ~ 28th Nov. 2009. Spacious Rooms: In comparison to Metropark Mongkok, which I stayed before, they have big & spacious rooms, which is quite rare in Hong Kong even if you are just staying in their standard rooms!! Really marvellous!! Hotel Uniqueness: As the name of the hotel suggest, Hotel Plaza 8 Degree, everything in the hotel is slightly slanted, be it the hotel main door entrance, the flooring, the glasses in their cafe, the tape in the hotel rooms also have to be turn on slanted to that certain degree!! Wonderful place & uniqueness is really superb!! Efficient & Caring Staff: Hotel staff is courteous & efficient, though their check-in is a little disappointment... we reach the hotel ard 5pm & yet, our room is still not ready!! However, the staff is quick to solve the problem & invited us to their cafe for a welcome drink.... I would say the staff is quick to let us feel at home right away! During this holiday trip, I was down with flu, the concierge in the lobby assist & direct me to where I can find the nearest doctor, I would sincerely thanks their hotel room service attendant who really make my day!! Making me feel so much better!! (Sori! I'm not sure what is his name) I came back after seeing doctor & he greeted me warmly as he was outside my room (cleaning up for the other customers), so I responded, thinking that its norm that they greet their customers & that's it. (like the concierge in the lobby) I was wrong!! He quickly noticed that I was ill (with a bag of medicines), & quickly asked if the room air-con is too cold for me, & if I would like another blanket, & when I replied "Yes! That would be great!" You wouldn't expect him to quickly bring me 1, which he did so & also on his own initiative, brought me another pillow too, in order to make sure I have a good rest, telling me to put 3 pillows together, then I can sleep higher & phlegm will be eased in that manner. I'm really touched by his kind thoughts!! The staff in the house-keeping dept is also very attentive, they noticed that my room isn't tidy yet & called me to ask if I would like their staff to come in & clean up the room so that I can have a clean environment to rest in. I stayed in 5* hotels quite often, but I never have such excellent service. REally Salutation to the Hotel- House-keeping dept. for having such excellent staff!! However, I would like to comment that the shuttle bus serviced by the hotel needs improvement & if possible, shorten the waiting time, as well as not to led the customers to a "merry-go-round" in their shuttle bus route, which is really a waste of time!! To sum it up, I would give a 4.5* rating to the hotel & if they can make some changes to the shuttle bus route & timing, that would definitely be a 5* rating!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you know Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C
Reviews.Content: Location is just horrible. Yes they have this shuttle bus service offering to the hung hum station, tsim sha tsui, even to kowloon bay (who knows why), but you need to be in good time management, otherwise if you misses one and you don't know how to go to To Kwa Wai, you are in big trouble. Checked in at 10:30, totally understandable rooms aren't ready as the check in standard is at 2, so we went out a bit before returning at 2:15, room still NOT ready! Had to sit in the lobby for another 15 minutes before getting the keys, no apology whatsoever. During night you can just hear people talk next door, their telly, people running along the corridor, I've got a bunch of people next door talking loudly at 6 IN THE MORNING, could hardly sleep! Given the fact that this is a brand new hotel, I was hoping for something exciting, no chance. The design of the bathroom is a load of rubbish. When you turn on the sink tap water just spills everywhere; there was only one master light in the room, meaning either light or dark; the air con ventilation just blows directly into your face; there were hair on the linens; a damaged hairdryer; no daily toiletries and water refilled; the path to the pool side bar is a maze, same with the gym room; the business centre on the ground floor looks so small, I didn't even bother entering. And guess what, ''Salon'' is not a beauty salon, it's one of their function rooms! Looks like it's not my apartment that needs a renovation, the 8 degrees does.

Reviews.Title: “A great addition to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: GCLLondon
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this newly opened hotel, located at the site of the former airport and were pleasantly surprised by its service and setting (after having read some of the comments). Everything in the hotel is designed in an angle and even the glasses in the Restaurant (which is really cool). The location is an incentive if you like to experience the more traditional HK and easy for us, as close to various local offices. the hotel did offer a shuttle service that runs well on time and the concierge was helpful when we required a chauffeur driven car on the various occasion. We would return to the hotel and recommend to friends and colleagues as the value for money was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “i ll not stay again”
Reviews.Author: lutfu
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel between 27th to 31st of october 2009 I have booked my room directly from hotel agency I book delux room which is shown in their internet site 32sqm, rate 1050HK$ when i get in my room it was shock, room was smaller then 20sqm I asked the reception to give me bigger room which is correct size what they show in internet but there was no room in this size Asistant manager name is Mrs Judith really helpful to me. This hotel is lucky that have some staff like her.She show me a room at 21st floor which is exutive floor but the room was again small I dont like it then she offer me for suit room not upgrated just need to pay aproximitely 300HK$ more I accepted it when I was checkout I saw the price 2370HK$ per night on my invoice normaly must be 1320HK$ I refused to pay this amount they show me contract which was sign when I was checkin. On that contract 1050HK$ was canceled (scratch by pen) then on the right side of canceled price written new price by hand 1320HK$ I sign this one. But when i check out they show me contract 1050HK$ scratc by pen + 1320HK$ under 1050 HK$ total 2370HK$ written by pen I said when I sign it there was just 1320HK$ not pluss 1050HK$ and total 2370HK$ I said can not be like that (I think front desk staff mistake) please find Mrs Judith and ask her she knows very well the story they said Mrs Judith is on vocation can not contact with her on that moment. In the end after many arguing I paid high price they said that will contact with agency on monday if any thing wrong they will correct it They really did it and refound money.It was headach for me.
